strategyDetails:
Meteor Beam is Nihilego's most important move, boosting Special Attack and muscling past checks like Celesteela once they're chipped. Sludge Wave hits tier staples like Primarina, Tangrowth, and Hydreigon. Thunderbolt allows Nihilego to hit Steel-types like Jirachi and Aegislash neutrally and other checks like Celesteela and Slowking super effectively. Power Gem can be used in place of Thunderbolt for a more reliable hit on Pokemon like Mandibuzz, Salamence, Thundurus-T, and Galarian Moltres. Grass Knot deals with Ground-types like Krookodile, Swampert, and Quagsire. Hex is an option to pressure Jirachi and Aegislash. Pain Split can be used to give Nihilego some recovery, though the lack of coverage creates more issues. Power Herb is required for Meteor Beam. The given EV spread and a Timid nature make Speed Nihilego's highest stat for Beast Boost, letting it outspeed revenge killers like Keldeo and Choice Scarf Krookodile.

This set fits on hyper offense teams, where Nihilego can KO weakened checks like Celesteela with Meteor Beam to boost both its Speed and Special Attack. Entry hazard setters like Krookodile and Excadrill help Nihilego by weakening some of its checks, like Nidoking and Celesteela. Keldeo and Belly Drum Azumarill are extremely strong wallbreakers that can punch holes for Nihilego to sweep late-game, destroying Chansey, Celesteela, and Excadrill. Secondary sweepers like Gyarados and Galarian Moltres can break past or dent Nidoking and Steel-types like Jirachi, Aegislash, and Celesteela. In return, Nihilego can remove Thundurus-T. Indeedee-F can provide Psychic Terrain to prevent Nihilego from being revenge killed by Aqua Jet from Azumarill and Crawdaunt. It can also patch up Nihilego with Healing Wish.
